info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:32PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Mineral, southern Lake, west central Missoula and southeastern Sanders Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 232 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alberton, or 19 miles east of Superior, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
